member.name: T:SharpLearning.CrossValidation.Augmentators.ContinuousMungeAugmentator
member.summary: Augmentates continuous data according to the MUNGE method: https://www.cs.cornell.edu/~caruana/compression.kdd06.pdf The method seeks to keep the original distribution of data. This is done by traversing each observation in the dataset finding its nearest neighbour (euclidean distance) and modifiyng each feature in the observation according to a probability. The features are modified using the value from the nearest neighbour as the mean when sampling a new value from a uniform distribution.

member.name: M:SharpLearning.CrossValidation.Augmentators.ContinuousMungeAugmentator.#ctor(System.Double,System.Double,System.Int32)
member.summary: Augmentates continuous data according to the MUNGE method: https://www.cs.cornell.edu/~caruana/compression.kdd06.pdf The method seeks to keep the original distribution of data. This is done by traversing each observation in the dataset finding its nearest neighbour (euclidean distance) and modifiyng each feature in the observation according to a probability. The features are modified using the value from the nearest neighbour as the mean when sampling a new value from a uniform distribution.
member.param: The probability that a feature will be altered with its nearest neighbour. Must be between 0.0 and 1.0. (Default is 0.2)
Variance when sampling a new value for an augmentated sample. (Default is 1.0)
Seed for random augmentation

member.name: M:SharpLearning.CrossValidation.Augmentators.ContinuousMungeAugmentator.Agument(SharpLearning.Containers.Matrices.F64Matrix)
member.summary: Returns the agumented version of the data. Excluding the original. The each feature in the dataset must be scaled/normnalized between 0.0 and 1.0 before the method works.

member.name: T:SharpLearning.CrossValidation.Augmentators.NominalMungeAugmentator
member.summary: Augmentates nominal data according to the MUNGE method: https://www.cs.cornell.edu/~caruana/compression.kdd06.pdf The method seeks to keep the original distribution of data. This is done by traversing each observation in the dataset finding its nearest neighbour (euclidean distance) and modifiyng each feature in the observation according to a probability. The features are modified using the value from the nearest neighbour as the mean when sampling a new value from a uniform distribution.

member.summary: Augmentates nominal data according to the MUNGE method: https://www.cs.cornell.edu/~caruana/compression.kdd06.pdf The method seeks to keep the original distribution of data. This is done by traversing each observation in the dataset finding its nearest neighbour (euclidean distance) and modifiyng each feature in the observation according to a probability. The features are modified using the value from the nearest neighbour as the mean when sampling a new value from a uniform distribution.
member.param: The probability that a feature will be altered with its nearest neighbour. Must be between 0.0 and 1.0. (Default is 0.2)

member.name: T:SharpLearning.CrossValidation.LearningCurves.ILearningCurvesCalculator`1
member.summary:
Bias variance analysis calculator for constructing learning curves. Learning curves can be used to determine if a model has high bias or high variance.
Solutions for model with high bias: - Add more features. - Use a more sophisticated model - Decrease regularization. Solutions for model with high variance - Use fewer features. - Use more training samples. - Increase Regularization.

member.name: M:SharpLearning.CrossValidation.LearningCurves.ILearningCurvesCalculator`1.Calculate(SharpLearning.Common.Interfaces.IIndexedLearner{`0},SharpLearning.Containers.Matrices.F64Matrix,System.Double[])
member.summary: Returns a list of BiasVarianceLearningCurvePoints for constructing learning curves. The points contain sample size, training score and validation score.

member.name: T:SharpLearning.CrossValidation.LearningCurves.LearningCurvesCalculator`1
member.summary:
Bias variance analysis calculator for constructing learning curves. Learning curves can be used to determine if a model has high bias or high variance.
Solutions for model with high bias: - Add more features. - Use a more sophisticated model - Decrease regularization. Solutions for model with high variance - Use fewer features. - Use more training samples. - Increase Regularization.
Bias variance analysis calculator for constructing learning curves. Learning curves can be used to determine if a model has high bias or high variance.
member.param: Type of shuffler to use when splitting data
The error metric used
A list of sample percentages determining the training data used in each point of the learning curve
How many times should the data be shuffled pr. calculated point

member.summary: Returns a list of BiasVarianceLearningCurvePoints for constructing learning curves. The points contain sample size, training score and validation score.
member.param: Indices that should be used for training
Indices that should be used for validation

member.name: T:SharpLearning.CrossValidation.LearningCurves.NoShuffleLearningCurvesCalculator`1
member.summary:
Bias variance analysis calculator for constructing learning curves. Learning curves can be used to determine if a model has high bias or high variance.
The order of the data is kept when splitting the data.
Solutions for model with high bias: - Add more features. - Use a more sophisticated model - Decrease regularization. Solutions for model with high variance - Use fewer features. - Use more training samples. - Increase Regularization.

member.name: M:SharpLearning.CrossValidation.LearningCurves.NoShuffleLearningCurvesCalculator`1.#ctor(SharpLearning.Common.Interfaces.IMetric{System.Double,`0},System.Double[],System.Double)
member.summary:
Bias variance analysis calculator for constructing learning curves. Learning curves can be used to determine if a model has high bias or high variance.
The order of the data is kept when splitting the data.
member.param: The error metric used
A list of sample percentages determining the training data used in each point of the learning curve
Total percentage of data used for training

member.name: T:SharpLearning.CrossValidation.LearningCurves.RandomShuffleLearningCurvesCalculator`1
member.summary:
Bias variance analysis calculator for constructing learning curves. Learning curves can be used to determine if a model has high bias or high variance.
The order of the data is randomized.
Solutions for model with high bias: - Add more features. - Use a more sophisticated model - Decrease regularization. Solutions for model with high variance - Use fewer features. - Use more training samples. - Increase Regularization.

member.name: M:SharpLearning.CrossValidation.LearningCurves.RandomShuffleLearningCurvesCalculator`1.#ctor(SharpLearning.Common.Interfaces.IMetric{System.Double,`0},System.Double[],System.Double,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Bias variance analysis calculator for constructing learning curves. Learning curves can be used to determine if a model has high bias or high variance.
The order of the data is randomized.
member.param: The error metric used
A list of sample percentages determining the training data used in each point of the learning curve
Number of shuffles done at each sampling point
Total percentage of data used for training

member.name: M:SharpLearning.CrossValidation.LearningCurves.RandomShuffleLearningCurvesCalculator`1.#ctor(SharpLearning.Common.Interfaces.IMetric{System.Double,`0},System.Double[],System.Double,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Bias variance analysis calculator for constructing learning curves. Learning curves can be used to determine if a model has high bias or high variance. The order of the data is randomized.
member.param: The error metric used
A list of sample percentages determining the training data used in each point of the learning curve
Number of shuffles done at each sampling point

member.name: T:SharpLearning.CrossValidation.LearningCurves.StratifiedLearningCurvesCalculator`1
member.summary:
Bias variance analysis calculator for constructing learning curves. Learning curves can be used to determine if a model has high bias or high variance.
The order of the data is stratified to have similar destributions in training and validation set.
Solutions for model with high bias: - Add more features. - Use a more sophisticated model - Decrease regularization. Solutions for model with high variance - Use fewer features. - Use more training samples. - Increase Regularization.

member.name: M:SharpLearning.CrossValidation.LearningCurves.StratifiedLearningCurvesCalculator`1.#ctor(SharpLearning.Common.Interfaces.IMetric{System.Double,`0},System.Double[],System.Double,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Bias variance analysis calculator for constructing learning curves. Learning curves can be used to determine if a model has high bias or high variance.
The order of the data is stratified to have similar destributions in training and validation set.
member.param: The error metric used
A list of sample percentages determining the training data used in each point of the learning curve
Total percentage of data used for training
Number of shuffles done at each sampling point

member.summary: Interface for index sampler.

member.summary: Random index sampler. Takes at random a sample of size sample size

member.summary: Random index sampler. Takes at random a sample of size sample size

member.summary: Random index sampler. Takes at random a sample of size sample size. Only samples within the indices provided in dataIndices

member.name: T:SharpLearning.CrossValidation.Samplers.StratifiedIndexSampler`1
member.summary: Stratified index sampler. Samples. Takes a stratified sample of size sampleSize with distributions equal to the input data. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stratified_sampling Returns a set of indices corresponding to the samples chosen.
member.typeparam: Returns a set of indices corresponding to the samples chosen.

member.name: M:SharpLearning.CrossValidation.Samplers.StratifiedIndexSampler`1.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Stratified index sampler. Samples. Takes a stratified sample of size sampleSize with distributions equal to the input data. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stratified_sampling Returns a set of indices corresponding to the samples chosen.

member.name: M:SharpLearning.CrossValidation.Samplers.StratifiedIndexSampler`1.Sample(`0[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Takes a stratified sample of size sampleSize with distributions equal to the input data. Returns a set of indices corresponding to the samples chosen.

member.name: M:SharpLearning.CrossValidation.Samplers.StratifiedIndexSampler`1.Sample(`0[],System.Int32,System.Int32[])
member.summary: Takes a stratified sample of size sampleSize with distributions equal to the input data. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stratified_sampling Returns a set of indices corresponding to the samples chosen. Only samples within the indices provided in dataIndices

member.name: T:SharpLearning.CrossValidation.TrainingTestSplitters.ITrainingTestIndexSplitter`1
member.summary: Interface for training test index splitters

member.name: T:SharpLearning.CrossValidation.TrainingTestSplitters.NoShuffleTrainingTestIndexSplitter`1
member.summary: Creates a set of training and test indices based on the provided targets. The indices are not shuffled before the split keeping the order of the data.

member.summary: Creates a set of training and test indices based on the provided targets. The indices are not shuffled before the split keeping the order of the data.

member.name: T:SharpLearning.CrossValidation.TrainingTestSplitters.RandomTrainingTestIndexSplitter`1
member.summary: Creates a set of training and test indices based on the provided targets. The indices are randomly shuffled before the split.

member.name: M:SharpLearning.CrossValidation.TrainingTestSplitters.RandomTrainingTestIndexSplitter`1.#ctor(System.Double)
member.summary: Creates a set of training and test indices based on the provided targets. The indices are randomly shuffled before the split.

member.summary: Creates a set of training and test indices based on the provided targets. The indices are randomly shuffled before the split.

member.name: T:SharpLearning.CrossValidation.TrainingTestSplitters.StratifiedTrainingTestIndexSplitter`1
member.summary: Creates a set of training and test indices based on the provided targets. The indices are stratified before the split. This ensure that the distributions of training set and test set are equal or at least very similar.

member.name: M:SharpLearning.CrossValidation.TrainingTestSplitters.StratifiedTrainingTestIndexSplitter`1.#ctor(System.Double,System.Int32)
member.summary: The indices are stratified before the split. This ensure that the distributions of training set and test set are equal or at least very similar.
